name: Constitutional Law
characteristics: Rare in databases but exists (e.g. shareholder equality)

name: Mandatory Law
characteristics: Cannot be overridden. Examples: director liability and minimum thresholds

name: Default Law
characteristics: Applies in the absence of statutory choice. Example: default majority in SARL

name: Statutes
characteristics: Takes precedence over suppletive law and subordinate to mandatory law

name: Internal Rules
characteristics: Specifies operations and subordinate to statutes. Very common internationally

name: Board Decision
characteristics: Can set operational rules but not opposable to shareholders

name: Shareholders Agreement
characteristics: Real governance but not opposable to the company (depending on country)

name: Investment Agreement
characteristics: Veto rights and board seats. Often temporary but structuring

name: Governance Code
characteristics: Comply or explain. Non-mandatory but structuring

name: Case Law
characteristics: Binding interpretation and varies by country
